snippet: To meet the federally mandated fleet average of 54.5 miles per gallon by 2025, automakers are choosing from steel, aluminum and carbon fiber to make their cars lighter.
abstract: Automakers are developing high-strength lightweight steel, aluminum and carbon fiber to make cars lighter and meet federally mandated fleet average of 54.5 miles per gallon by 2025.
lead_paragraph: To meet the federally mandated fleet average of 54.5 miles per gallon by 2025, automakers are choosing from steel, aluminum and carbon fiber to make their cars lighter.

headline.seo: For Lightweight Cars, a Race Among Steel, Aluminum and Carbon Fiber
headline.main: For Lightweight Cars, a Materials Race
headline.print_headline: For Lightweight Cars, A Materials Race
